oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter to Governor Frank G. Clement from Oscar Sutermeister of Bethesda, Maryland regarding civil defense
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oscar Sutermeister of Bethesda, Maryland writes to Governor Frank Clement about the vulnerability of Tennessee to nuclear attack. He references a study he is working on for Milwaukee, Wisconsin focused on a "reduction of vulnerability" program. Sutermeister argues that state legislation is important to a "reduction of vulnerability" program and emphasizes the threat to state fiscal health should there be an attack on an urban area.

Oscar Sutermeister held a master's degree in regional planning from Harvard University. During World War II, he served with the Navy. After the war, he became a civilian employee of the Navy working on projects involving city planning, housing, and transportation for the Navy.
